org.xlattice.protocol.stun

Class BindingServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.xlattice.protocol.stun.BindingServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, StunConst

    public class BindingServer
extends java.lang.Thread
implements StunConst
    A simple stateless single-threaded server that receives STUN messages on a UDP port and relays replies through an array of BindingSenders. We need four of these in the STUN server, one for each of the four combinations of primary/secondary address and primary/secondary port. XXX MUST CHECK FOR STALE SECRETS (grep on EXTRACT TIME)
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Detail

      • BindingServer

        protected BindingServer(java.net.DatagramSocket socket,
                        java.net.Inet4Address priAddr,
                        int priPort,
                        java.net.Inet4Address secAddr,
                        int secPort,
                        javax.crypto.SecretKey secret1,
                        javax.crypto.SecretKey secret2,
                        boolean authOptional,
                        BindingSender[] senders,
                        java.lang.String logDir,
                        boolean verbose)
        Creates a binding server which listens on the socket passed and optionally permits or enforces authentication. For authentication to be possible two SecretKeys must be supplied, one for validating client usernames and the other for validating client passwords. Client may specify that BindingResponses are to be sent from any of four address/port combinations, so BindingResponse messages are relayed through an array of four BindingSenders which run on separate threads.
        Parameters:
        socket - used for receiving messages
        priAddr - primary server address
        priPort - primary server port
        secAddr - secondary server address
        secPort - secondary server port
        secret1 - if present, used for creating username HMACs
        secret2 - used for creating passwords
        authOptional - whether clients may omit authentication
        senders - used for sending messages from different address/port

      • BindingServer

        protected BindingServer(java.net.DatagramSocket socket,
